alert.note: Alert for Hansford; Lipscomb; Ochiltree; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 18 at 10:20PM CDT until May 18 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR BEAVER...TEXAS...NORTHWESTERN LIPSCOMB...NORTHERN HANSFORD... NORTHEASTERN SHERMAN AND OCHILTREE COUNTIES... At 1020 PM CDT, automated weather equipment reported severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Fowler to 13 miles southwest of Hardesty, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Guymon, Perryton, Beaver, Hooker, Booker, Goodwell, Gruver, Tyrone, Forgan, Optima, Hardesty, Gate, Knowles, Wolf Creek Park, Baker, Balko, Elmwood, Hough, Adams and Farnsworth. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
